name: Sierra Madre Sunrise
description: This mezcal drink, made with bittersweet Aperol and fresh lemon, can go two ways: with Angostura bitters, it's spicy-earthy-cinnamony. Or try chocolate bitters, which play up the sweet and bitter orange flavors in the Aperol.
recipeIngredient: 1 ounce mezcal, such as Del Maguey Vida
1/2 ounce freshly squeezed juice from 1/2 lemon
2 to 3 dashes of either Angostura or chocolate bitters, such as Scrappy’s

recipeInstructions.text: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add mezcal, Aperol, lemon juice, and bitters. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Fill a rocks glass with fresh ice. Add club soda to glass and strain cocktail on top. Garnish with lemon peel.
